name: Hardest "Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan," Part 2 Trivia Quiz | Movies | 20 Questions
tags: ST II: The Wrath of Khan

questions.text: For most of the film, Khan Noonien Singh (Ricardo Montalban) wears a shirt that shows off a well-defined set of pectoral muscles.  True or false: Montalban wore a prosthetic device in order to give Khan the appearance of a highly muscular chest.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Director Nicholas Meyer emphatically states several times on the DVD that the chest we see is actually Ricardo Montalban's.  No prosthetic of any kind was employed.

questions.text: A shuttle carrying Admiral James T. Kirk (William Shatner) and several of his bridge crew approaches the ENTERPRISE while it is still in spacedock.  Where, exactly, does the shuttle dock with the starship?
questions.explanation:
port side, torpedo bay.

	Commander Hikaru Sulu (George Takei) is instructed to approach "port side, torpedo bay" as he guides the shuttle toward the ENTERPRISE.

questions.text: Technically, Kirk and company are only boarding the ENTERPRISE for the purposes of a training mission.  How long was said training mission supposed to last, before Khan complicated matters?
questions.explanation:
three weeks.

	Kirk says to Sulu, "I'm glad you'll be at the helm for three weeks.  I don't think these kids can steer."

questions.text: Midshipman First Class Peter Preston (Ike Eisenmann) is a rather brash young officer in Engineering.  What is his relation to Commander Montgomery Scott (James Doohan)?
questions.explanation:
he is Scotty's nephew.

	In the restored version of the film seen on the DVD -- and in the TV version of the film -- we hear Scotty tell Kirk that Preston is his sister's youngest child.  This explains why Scotty was so distraught upon Preston's death following Khan's first attack on the ENTERPRISE.

questions.text: When Kirk accesses the top-secret file pertaining to the Genesis Project, he is subjected to a procedure to confirm his identity.  What portion of himself does he need to present for this scan?
questions.explanation:
his retina.

	Retina scans were still "futuristic" in 1982, but less than a decade later, they became real-life fixtures in certain high-tech circles.

questions.text: Kirk, Dr. McCoy (DeForrest Kelley), and Captain Spock (Leonard Nimoy) watch a recording of Dr. Carol Marcus (Bibi Besch) describing the Genesis Project.  How long ago was the recording made?
questions.explanation:
one year.

	Kirk states that the proposal was made "about a year ago."

questions.text: James Horner composed the remarkable score for "Star Trek II."  Which of the following films did Horner *not* score?
options: "Star Trek III: The Search For Spock" (1984)
questions.explanation:
"The Abyss" (1989).

	Some passages from Horner's "Aliens" score were used in the trailers for "The Abyss," but Alan Silvestri scored the actual film.

questions.text: Lt. Saavik (Kirstie Alley) quotes a Starfleet regulation to Kirk when the RELIANT is approaching without responding to standard hails.  Which general order does she quote?
questions.explanation:
General Order 12.

	Saavik: "General Order 12 states that, on the approach of any vessel when communications have not been established..."  We never hear the rest of it, because Spock cuts her off.

questions.text: Finish this quote from Khan: "Have you ever heard the Klingon proverb that revenge is a dish that is best served __________?"
questions.explanation:
cold.

	Khan follows this up with, "It is very cold... in space."

questions.text: Which character does *not* use the mild curse "damn" in this film?
questions.explanation:
Scotty.

	Saavik says "Damn" during her KOBAYASHI MARU test, which is odd for a Vulcan.  Kirk says, "This is damn peculiar" as the RELIANT approaches with no communications.  Chekov, once he realizes that he and his captain are in Khan's territory on Ceti Alpha V, says, "We've got to get out of here.  Damn!"  Scotty has used this word in other "Trek" films, but not in this one.

questions.text: After Khan's surprise attack cripples the ENTERPRISE, he demands that Kirk give him all the data he has on the Genesis Project.  How long does Khan declare that Kirk has to retrieve this information?
questions.explanation:
one minute.

	Khan tells Kirk that he only has one minute, but the actual time that elapses before Khan says "Time!" is just over *two* minutes.  Ah, movies.

questions.text: Space Station Regula 1, the "home base" of the Genesis Project, orbits a planetoid called, appropriately enough, Regula.  According to Spock, what class planetoid is Regula?
questions.explanation:
D.

	Spock goes on to describe the class D planetoid as "essentially, a great rock in space."

questions.text: Saavik, ever fond of quoting Starfleet regulations, brings up General Order 15 to Kirk.  What is the main import of General Order 15?
questions.correct: No flag officer shall beam into a hazardous area without armed escort.
options: No civilian research facility shall be boarded without the express permission of the chief science officer of said facility.
No command officer shall endanger the lives of Starfleet cadets unnecessarily.
No illegally commandeered Starfleet vessel shall be destroyed without first consulting Starfleet Command.
questions.explanation:
No flag officer shall beam into a hazardous area without armed escort.

	Kirk seems not to know this directive at all -- "There's no such regulation," he says -- but he quickly relents, and permits Saavik to act as bodyguard for McCoy and himself on Space Station Regula 1.

questions.text: A landing party cautiously searches Space Station Regula 1.  Who is the first to find a dead body?
questions.explanation:
McCoy.

	McCoy literally bumps into a dead man hanging upside-down.  His eyes grow as wide as saucers as he instinctively barks out, "Jim!"  (Uhura wasn't even part of the search party; she was handling communications back on the ENTERPRISE.)

questions.text: Dr. McCoy determines that the massacre of numerous scientists at Space Station Regula 1 happened fairly recently.  How does he know this?
questions.correct: Rigor mortis has not yet set in.
options: The telltale smell of dead bodies does not yet exist.
Cellular decay has not yet taken place.
questions.explanation:
Rigor mortis has not yet set in.

	McCoy: "Well, rigor hasn't set in yet.  This couldn't have happened too long ago, Jim."

questions.text: Commander Pavel Chekov (Walter Koenig) and his captain (Paul Winfield), thanks to the "Ceti Eel" worms, are the slaves of Khan Noonien Singh.  What does Chekov's captain call Khan?
questions.explanation:
Your Excellency.

	Captain Clark Terrell: "Have you been listening, Your Excellency?"

questions.text: According to Dr. Carol Marcus, how long did it take the Starfleet Corps of Engineers to dig the necessary subterranean tunnels beneath the surface of Regula?
questions.explanation:
ten months.

	Carol notes that, in contrast, her work in "the Genesis cave" took only a single day.

questions.text: Joachim (Judson Scott), Khan's chief lieutenant, was also Khan's son.
questions.explanation:
False.

	There's no evidence whatsoever, in the script or elsewhere, suggesting that Khan was Joachim's father.  In fact, since Joachim is easily in his twenties, it would be impossible for Khan to have fathered him after the Ceti Alpha V exile (15 years ago).

questions.text: As the ENTERPRISE is about to lead the RELIANT into the Mutara Nebula, Spock uncharacteristically uses a metaphor to explain to Saavik why Kirk has decided to do so.  What animal does Spock invoke in this metaphor?
questions.explanation:
a goose.

	Saavik asks why Kirk wants to enter a nebula where sensors and shields will be useless.  "Sauce for the goose, Mr. Saavik," Spock says.  "The odds will be even."

questions.text: Spock's intuition saves the day, as usual, once the ENTERPRISE and the RELIANT are playing hide-and-seek in the Mutara Nebula.  He assesses Khan's tactics, and reports to Kirk: "He's intelligent, but not experienced.  His actions suggest two-dimensional thinking."  This observation prompts Kirk to tell Sulu to change the ship's "z" orientation -- its "vertical" stance.  How far does Kirk tell Sulu to "drop" the ENTERPRISE?
questions.explanation:
ten thousand meters.

	Kirk: "Mister Sulu -- 'z' minus ten kilometers."  "Dropping" the ship in such a manner allows Kirk to maneuver under and behind the RELIANT.  Eventually, the ENTERPRISE is directly behind the RELIANT, which allows for a significant tactical advantage. One more quiz to go!  Stay tuned for Part 3.
